title: Ricardo Pérez Castillo
text:
I am a Graduate Student in Statistics at UC Berkeley with a background in large-scale data engineering and consulting.
Previously, I was a Senior Software Delivery Analyst at McKinsey & Company and a Consulting Analyst at Deloitte, where I built ETL pipelines handling hundreds of millions of rows, designed data warehouse architectures and extracted insights from data.
My focus is on the intersection of robust data engineering and data science. I enjoy building reproducible pipelines that enable advanced analytics.

Atos IT Challenge 2020 - 2nd Place Winner
For the Atos IT Challenge, our team developed a machine learning prototype designed to help city utility managers forecast water demand and prevent shortages. The system analyzed network data to estimate “days-to-threshold” for safe water levels.

title: Digital Water Forecast
text:
The Problem
City water networks struggle with efficiency. Leaks and unpredicted demand spikes can lead to critical shortages. Our goal was to move from reactive maintenance to proactive forecasting.

title: Digital Water Forecast
text:
The Solution
We built an end-to-end Python pipeline that: 1. Ingested historical consumption data. 2. Cleaned and aggregated time-series data. 3. Trained a forecasting model (using libraries like Scikit-Learn/Statsmodels). 4. Visualized the “Days to Critical Threshold” on a dashboard.

Key Technologies

Python: Core logic and data processing.
Pandas/NumPy: Time-series manipulation.
Scikit-Learn: Model training.

text:

Placed 2nd among hundreds of international teams.
Presented the solution directly to the CEO of Atos and the Scientific Board.
